publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1849# Colin Fox: Review of NHS Prescription Charges—That the Parliament notes the remit of the Scottish Executive’s review of NHS prescription charges which will take place in two phases, firstly a five-month comparative study of international prescribing and exemption regimes followed by a three-month public consultation and believes that, following the recent decision of the National Assembly for Wales to abolish these charges, the review should also consider this option.
S2M-1849# Review of NHS Prescription Charges (lodged on 11 October 2004) Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-1849# Review of NHS Prescription Charges (lodged on 11 October 2004) Elaine Smith*, Campbell Martin*, Chris Ballance*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, John Swinburne*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-1849# Review of NHS Prescription Charges (lodged on 11 October 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-1849# Review of NHS Prescription Charges (lodged on 11 October 2004) Tommy Sheridan*, Rosie Kane*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1849# Review of NHS Prescription Charges (lodged on 11 October 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
